🎮 Working on The Tinkerer's Tournament movement system this week. 
Time for a story about AI, human experience, and the importance of reading the docs!

#gamedev #frontend #svelte

🧵 1/8

⚠️ Warning: Even after feeding complete Svelte documentation to my "Nono the LLM robot" (a.k.a. Claude), things got... surprising!

🧵 2/8

🤖 Step 0: Setup for success?
Gave Nono all it needed: full Svelte docs, codebase context, clear task - just refresh highlighted cells when a character moves.
Should be straightforward, right?

🧵 3/8

🐌 Step 1: First AI suggestion
"Use $derived + function!"

Results? 286 re-renders per click. That's one render per cell, with pathfinding recalculation each time! 
Not great when you're making a game...

🧵 4/8

🐛 Step 2: Quick fix trap
"Let's use $effects + state sync!"

Speed coding and blindly trusting AI led straight into anti-pattern territory. Works but... at what cost?

🧵 5/8

🎯 Step 3: Experience kicks in
Something felt off. Time to RTFM myself!

Solution? "$derived.by (+ untrack)": Clean, efficient, and actually following Svelte's philosophy!

🧵 6/8

💡 Key lesson?
AI is an amazing partner but experience matters. When something feels off, trust your gut and check the docs.

AI + Human Experience is the way, with "Double Check" as your mantra!

🧵 7/8

📖 Full story with code samples in this week's Maeevick's Bazaar (every Sunday at 10am CET): https://maeevick.substack.com

#gamedev #svelte #buildinpublic 

🧵 8/8
